itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Bangalore | Transfer to Coorg via Mysore | Mysore Sightseeing Tour
activities: Welcome to the Garden City of India! Upon arrival at Bangalore Airport/Railway Station, take the provided transfer to Coorg, enjoying picturesque views en route. Passing through Mysore, you'll be driven to visit city's famous landmarks like Chamundeshwari Temple, Mysore Palace, and Mysore Zoological Park. Also, visit the Mysore Wax Museum, the Gothic St. Philomena Church, and the scenic Brindavan Gardens. Later, once you reach Coorg, check-in at your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 – Coorg Sightseeing Tour
activities: In the morning, you'll be transferred to explore Coorg on a sightseeing tour. First, visit Talacavery and Bhagamandala Temples, then head to Bramhagiri hills and admire the panoramic views of lush Coffee Plantations. Witness the scenic beauty of Abbey Falls followed by a visit to the Omkareshwar Temple and the Fort. End your tour at Raja's Seat, enjoying panoramic views of Coorg's scenic landscapes. Later, take the provided transfer back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Transfer to Ooty | Enroute Visit Pykara Lake and Waterfalls
activities: In the morning, check-out from your hotel and get transferred to Ooty. En route, visit Pykara Lake and Waterfalls and admire the stunning views of the lake surrounded by tall, dense trees. You can even opt for a boat ride on the lake (at extra cost). After spending some time at Pykara Lake and Waterfalls, continue your journey to Ooty. Upon arrival, check-in to your hotel and enjoy your overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Ooty Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, you'll be driven for a sightseeing tour of Ooty. Explore the lush Botanical Garden and enjoy the panoramic views of the Nilgiri Hills from Doddabetta Peak. Visit the Tea Garden, Factory, and Museum to learn about tea production. Stroll amid the vibrant blooms of the Rose Garden and enjoy a serene boat ride on Ooty Lake at the Boathouse. Later, get transferred back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Departure
activities: Today, you'll check out from the hotel in Ooty and get transferred to Bangalore Airport/ Railway Station. Upon arrival, you can begin your journey back home.

packages.title: Coorg, Ooty and Kodaikanal Tour Package ( 7 Days 6 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Destination Routes Coorg > Ooty > Kodaikanal > Bangalore

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Bangalore | Transfer to Coorg | Day at Leisure
activities: Welcome to Bangalore! Upon arrival at the Bangalore Airport\Railway Station, you'll be transferred to Coorg where you'll check in at your hotel. Later, you can head out and explore Coorg on your own. You can visit Mallalli Falls, known for its stunning surroundings, or Pushpagiri Wildlife Sanctuary, famous for its variety of birds. Alternatively, you can visit Nisargadhama, known for its elephant rides, among other attractions. Later, return to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Coorg Sightseeing Tour
activities: In the morning, board the transfer from your hotel for the Coorg sightseeing tour. During the day, you'll visit the sacred Talacauvery and Bhagamandala temples, followed by a hike up Bramhagiri Hills. You'll also explore the lush coffee plantations of Coorg and visit the stunning Abbey Falls. Conclude your tour with a visit to the historic Omkareshwar Temple and the famous Raja's Seat before being driven back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Transfer to Ooty | Day at Leisure
activities: Today, you'll check out from the hotel and board your transfer to Ooty, "The Queen of the Hill Stations." Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and enjoy the rest of the day at leisure, exploring the city on your own. You can visit the stunning Stone House, popular as the first house constructed in Ooty, or visit Pykara Lake situated in Pykara village. You can also explore Deer Park. Later, return to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Ooty Sightseeing Tour
activities: In the morning, get driven from your hotel to explore the city on a sightseeing tour. Begin with a visit to the Botanical Garden, known for a diverse range of plant species. Next, head to Doddabetta Peak, the highest point in the Nilgiris. Wander through the scenic Tea Garden and learn about the tea-making process at the Tea Factory and Museum. Visit the beautiful Rose Garden and the stunning Ooty Lake. Later, get transferred back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Transfer to Kodaikanal | Day at Leisure
activities: Bid adieu to Ooty as you check out from the hotel and get driven to Kodaikanal. Enjoy the scenic views of lush green valleys along the way. Once you reach Kodaikanal, check in to your hotel. You can either relax at your hotel or head out to explore Kodaikanal on your own by visiting places like Berijam Lake, a natural freshwater lake, or the stunning Kumbakkarai Falls, located in the foothills of Kodaikanal hills. Later, return to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 6 - Kodaikanal Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, you'll embark on a Kodaikanal sightseeing tour. First, get transferred to Kodaikanal Lake, where you can even opt for boating (at an additional cost). Next, head to the Pillar Rocks viewpoint to admire these three rocks standing tall at the height of 400 ft. Further, walk along Coaker's Walk, a scenic walkway. Also, explore Bryant Park, Guna Caves, Pine Forests, and Bear Shola Falls among other attractions. Later, get transferred back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 7 - Departure
activities: Today, check out from the hotel and get transferred to the Bangalore Airport/Railway Station. From there, you can begin your journey back home, marking the end of the trip.

packages.title: Coorg, Mysore and Ooty Tour Package ( 7 Days 6 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Bangalore < Coorg < Mysore < Ooty < Bangalore

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Bangalore | Bangalore Sightseeing Tour
activities: Welcome to Bangalore! Upon arrival at Bangalore Airport/Railway Station, get transferred to your hotel for check-in and rest. Later, get driven on your Bangalore Sightseeing Tour. Begin at Lalbagh Botanical Garden, showcasing historic structures and lush landscapes. Next, move on to Cubbon Park, where nature meets urban charm and visit ISKCON Temple, an architectural marvel. Finally, behold Vidhana Soudha, representing South India’s governance before getting driven to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 – Transfer to Coorg | Leisure Day
activities: Post check-out from your hotel, get driven to Coorg. En route, make a stop at Bylukuppe Tibetan Settlement and Kaveri Nisargadhama in Kushalanagar for serene landscapes and cultural insights. Upon arrival in Coorg, check into your hotel and spend the day at leisure. You can trek to Tadiandamol Peak, the highest in Coorg, offering stunning views of the Western Ghats. Next, you can enjoy the soothing sound of cascading water at Mallalli Falls and later, return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Coorg Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, get driven on a scenic day tour in Coorg! Begin at Talacauvery Temple, where the River Cauvery begins its journey from Bramhagiri hills. Next, visit Bhagamandala Temple nearby, known for the Triveni Sangama. Explore lush coffee plantations, then marvel at Abbey Falls. Later, experience the unique architecture of Omkareshwara Temple and delve into history at Madikeri Fort's museum. Conclude with a serene sunset at Raja Seat and get transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Transfer to Mysore | Day trip to Mysore Palace and Chamundeshwari Temple
activities: In the morning, check-out from your hotel and get driven to Mysore. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and rest for some time. Later, get transferred to Mysore Palace, a stunning example of Indo-Saracenic architecture. Explore its opulent halls and vibrant artworks reflecting royal splendor. Next, visit Chamundeshwari Temple atop Chamundi Hill, and experience the spiritual ambiance and intricate craftsmanship of this ancient temple. Afterwards, get driven to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Transfer to Ooty | Leisure Day
activities: Post check-out, get transferred to Ooty. Upon arrival, check into your hotel and spend the day at leisure. You can visit the historic Stone House, one of the oldest buildings in the town, offering a glimpse into its colonial past. Then, head to the serene Emerald Lake, surrounded by lush greenery, perfect for a leisurely stroll or boating. Finally, explore the Deer Park, home to various species of deer amidst natural surroundings. Later, return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 6 - Half Day Ooty Sightseeing Tour | Trip to Coonoor
activities: Today, embark on a delightful Ooty tour by getting driven to Ooty Lake, perfect for serene walks. Next, explore the Botanical Gardens for diverse flora and ascend Doddabetta Peak. Then, visit Rose Garden and get driven to Coonoor for a half day trip. There, explore the botanical wonders of Sim's Park and enjoy the stunning view from Dolphin's Nose. Next, marvel at the cascading Catherine Falls, and take in the scenic views from Lamb’s Rock. Afterwards, get driven to Ooty for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 7 - Departure Day
activities: In the morning, check out from your hotel and get driven to Bangalore. Upon arrival at Bangalore Airport/Railway Station, continue your journey towards home, marking an end to this trip.

destinations.title: South India Tour Package
destinations.highlight: We’ve proudly served over 1 lakh happy customers with our Tamil Nadu Getaway | Temple Trails and Coastal Charms tour packages – and their satisfaction speaks for itself.
destinations.about: At Tripdekhoo, we prioritize exceptional customer service and seamless experiences. From hotels, visas, and flights to sightseeing and end-to-end transfers, we take care of everything so you can travel stress-free.
knowBeforeYouGo: To make the most of your sightseeing tours and transfers, please be punctual. Timely departure is essential to ensure you cover all planned attractions and points of interest.
Please note that tickets and entry fees to all attractions are not included in the package.
Entry fees can vary, so it's a good idea to check the specific costs for each attraction in advance.

Heavy rainfalls are observed between June and September so itinerary changes are possible. In case the roads are blocked due to landslides or any other natural calamity, a permit may not be available to go.
Wear appropriate clothing, especially when visiting religious sites. Revealing attire is not culturally acceptable.
Public drinking is prohibited so consume alcohol only in licensed establishments or private spaces.
ID proof is mandatory for each visitor at the time of booking, and also upon arrival. PAN card will not be considered as a valid ID proof.
The tour takes place through an eco-friendly zone; do not encourage littering the local sites.
Kindly make sure to carry a pair of winter clothes as you will require it upon reaching Munnar, the hill station.
While credit and debit cards are widely accepted, it's advisable to carry some cash, especially when visiting remote areas where card facilities may be limited - like at Jatayu Earth Center.
Please note that the flight ticket prices might fluctuate, depending on the season and other circumstances.
The hotels listed are subject to availability and may have varying prices during long weekends and the holiday season.
Munnar rooms will not be AC in all hotels since these are hill stations (few hotels have AC options & available at additional cost).
Early check-in or late check-out is subject to availability and the hotel may charge extra for the same.

packages.title: Munnar< Thekkady < Alleppey < Kochi ( 5 Days 4 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Destination Routes Coorg < Ooty < Bangalore

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Kochi | Transfer to Munnar | En route Sightseeing || Athirapally Waterfall
activities: Upon arrival, board your transfer to Munnar. Make a stop to savour a traditional Kerala feast bursting with local flavours. En route, visit the majestic 7-tiered Cheeyappara Waterfalls. At Pottas Fun Farm, try activities (extra cost) such as ziplining and giant swing. Later, head to Pettimudi View Point for scenic views of tea estates. Afterwards, check in at the hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Munnar Sightseeing Tour
activities: Start your day with Tripdekhoo’s exclusive itinerary, including top attractions as well as hidden gems. Visit the Tata Tea Museum and learn about Munnar's rich tea heritage, then head to Macofa Chocolate Factory to sample chocolates and buy your favourite ones. At Mattupetty Dam, soak in the scenic views and try jet skiing (extra cost). Unwind on the beautiful meadows of Yellapatty Grasslands, relishing sunset views. You can choose to go for an Ayurvedic massage before concluding your day.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Transfer to Thekkady | En route Sightseeing | Thekkady Sightseeing Tour
activities: Check out and board your transfer to Thekkady. En route stop at the Chunayammakkal Waterfalls and enjoy a toy train ride and ziplining (extra cost). Relish an unparalleled view of the Kerala-Tamil Nadu border from Aruvikkuzhi Viewpoint. Upon arrival, enjoy a boat safari on Periyar Lake, spotting wildlife at Periyar National Park. Later return to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Transfer to Alleppey | En route Sightseeing | Houseboat Stay Experience
activities: After check out, travel to Alleppey, taking a stop at Parunthumpara Hill, famous for its 360-degree views and as a film shooting location. Upon arrival, visit Alleppey Beach and Marari Beach, known for their pristine golden sands and stunning views. Explore the historic Alleppey Lighthouse. Later, board your houseboat for a serene cruise through the backwaters, taking in the surrounding views. You can even take a turn to steer the houseboat, the experience of which will stay with you forever.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Kochi Sightseeing Tour | Departure Day
activities: Deboard the houseboat and head to Kochi. Visit the Dutch Palace, where vibrant murals intricately depict royal history and mythology bringing Kerala’s royal history to life. Marvel at the Jewish Synagogue’s ornate chandeliers & historic blue tiles. Visit St. Francis Church, Vasco da Gama’s original burial site. Cap off your day with a stroll along Marine Drive and observe the age-old Chinese Fishing Nets, a local fishing method still in practice. Get driven to Kochi Airport/Railway Station.

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Kochi | Transfer to Munnar & Sightseeing
activities: Prepare for an unforgettable journey with Tripdekhoo’s special experiences. Upon arrival in Kochi, get driven to Munnar, savoring a traditional Kerala feast along the way. Cross the Neriamangalam Bridge over the Periyar River & marvel at the stunning seven-tiered Cheeyappara Waterfall. At Pottas Fun Farm, enjoy activities (at an extra cost) such as ziplining, a giant swing, and a fish spa. Upon arrival, check in at your hotel, and cap off the day with Kathakali and martial arts performances.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Munnar Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, get driven for a city tour. Begin at the Tata Tea Museum and learn about the tea-making process. Visit the Macofa Chocolate Factory and enjoy an elephant ride at the Carmelagiri Elephant Park (at an extra cost). Admire the scenic views of Mattupetty Dam and visit Echo Point, known for its mesmerizing sound reflections. Take a walk through the vast, rolling Yellapatty Grasslands, and enjoy the boat rides at Kundala Lake (at extra costs). Later, unwind with a rejuvenating Ayurvedic massage.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Transfer to Alleppey | Houseboat Stay
activities: In the morning, check out from your hotel and get driven to Alleppey. Upon arrival, step aboard a traditional houseboat. As you glide along peaceful waterways, admire the picturesque views of paddy fields & coconut groves. You’ll also have the chance to learn about the traditional lifestyle of the local communities as you pass by their homes. You can also try steering the houseboat yourself as you sail through these calm and scenic waters.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Transfer to Kochi | Departure
activities: Deboard the houseboat & travel to Kochi. Upon arrival, visit the Dutch Palace, renowned for its intricate murals showcasing scenes from the Ramayana and Mahabharata. Next, explore the Jewish Synagogue, famous for its dazzling chandeliers & exquisite hand-painted blue tiles from China. Cap off your day with a romantic stroll along Marine Drive, where you’ll watch the sunset cast a golden glow over the Arabian Sea. Afterwards, get driven to Kochi Airport/ Railway Station for your onward journey.

packages.title: Phuentsholing<Thimphu< Paro< Phuentsholing< Siliguri ( 6 Days 5 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Destination Routes Phuentsholing<Thimphu< Paro< Phuentsholing< Siliguri
knowBeforeYouGo: The updated price is valid only for bookings with 4 adults.
Upon arrival, ask your guide to assist in purchasing a SIM card. Bhutan operates two networks: B-Mobile and TashiCell.
Obtain a visa for each night of your stay in Bhutan, as it's mandatory for all international travellers.
Ensure you have sufficient cash in Bhutanese Ngultrum (BTN), especially for remote areas, as ATMs and card facilities may be limited.

Indians must pay the Sustainable Development Fee (SDF) of Rs 1200 per person/per night. Children below 5 years are exempted from SDF, while kids between 6 and 12 years of age, will get 50% concession.
To obtain entry in Bhutan, Indian tourists must carry their passports with a minimum 6 months validity and make the payment of SDF.
Plastic has been banned since 1999 in Bhutan, therefore, it is advised to carry plastic/plastic items.
Keep your arms and legs covered while visiting a Dzong (fortress-monastery).
The official currency in Bhutan is the Bhutanese Ngultrum (BTN). It is advisable to exchange currency at banks or authorised exchange bureaus.

ID Proof is mandatory for each individual guest at the time of booking, and upon arrival. PAN Card will not be considered as a valid identity proof. All foreign nationals must carry their passport as a proof of identity.
Images are for representation purposes only.
Ask for permission from the attending authority before taking any photos or videos inside places like monasteries.
In Bhutan, Tuesday is ‘Dry Day’. This means locals don’t drink alcohol on Tuesday. So it would be respectful to avoid alcohol on Tuesdays too.
It’s illegal for tobacco to be sold in Bhutan. Tourists can bring cigarettes into the country, but can only smoke them in designated places.
Bhutan does not have a micro (or nano) SIM card. So check your mobile device for SIM compatibility before visiting Bhutan.
Credit cards are widely accepted in major cities and tourist areas. However, it is recommended to carry some cash.

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Siliguri | Transfer to Phuntsholing | Leisure Day
activities: Upon your arrival at Siliguri Railway Station or Bagdogra Airport, get driven to your hotel in Phuntsholing.
Check in and spend your time at leisure.
You can visit Bhutan Gate, a striking traditional gateway that beautifully marks the entry into Bhutan.
If you wish, you can also visit Amo Chhu Crocodile Breeding Centre lets you witness Bhutan’s wildlife conservation efforts up close, among other famous attractions.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Transfer to Thimphu | Leisure Day
activities: Today, check out from the hotel and visit the immigration office to obtain your travel permit.
Next, get driven to your hotel in Thimphu.
After checking in, take the day to explore at your own pace.
You can visit Clock Tower Square to admire the beautiful Bhutanese architecture, or immerse yourself in the nation’s history at Simply Bhutan.
If you’re a nature lover, you can explore the Royal Botanical Garden to see the variety of plant life.
Later, return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Thimphu Sightseeing Tour | Transfer to Paro
activities: In the morning, check out and get driven for a sightseeing tour of Thimphu.
First, admire the National Memorial Chorten, a stupa that celebrates Bhutan's third king.
Visit the Motithang Takin Preserve to catch a glimpse of Bhutan’s national animal.
Marvel at the enormous golden Buddha Dordenma statue & later, explore the Tashichho Dzong, a fortress-monastery that houses several temples and chapels.
After visiting other places, get driven to Paro & upon arrival, check in to the hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Hike to Tiger's Nest Monastery
activities: Today, check out and get transferred to the base of Tiger’s Nest Monastery.
Begin your hike, which takes you through lush pine forests adorned with colourful prayer flags fluttering in the breeze.
The trek offers stunning views of the surrounding valley and the monastery perched high on a cliff, at 3,120 meters above sea level.
Once at the monastery, step inside & explore its prayer wheels, intricate murals, and stunning artwork.
Afterwards, get driven back to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Transfer to Phuntsholing | Leisure Day
activities: After you check out in the morning, get driven to Phuntsholing.
After you arrive, check in at the hotel.
Later, you can spend your time exploring places like Zangto Pelri, a replica of Guru Rinpoche’s celestial abode.
Alternatively, you may admire stunning views from Karbandi Monastery, where lush gardens & prayer flags create a peaceful escape.
While exploring the town, you can try Bhutanese dishes like Ema Datshi (chilli cheese) & momos at local eateries, before returning back to the hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 6 - Transfer to Siliguri | Departure Day
activities: In the morning, check out of the hotel and get transferred to New Jalpaiguri Railway Station/Bagdogra International Airport.
En route, make a stop at the immigration office.
Continue your journey onward and this marks the end of your trip.

packages.title: FREE Excursion to Taktsang | Thimphu < Paro ( 5 Days 4 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Destination Routes Coorg > Ooty > Kodaikanal > Bangalore

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Paro | Transfer to Thimphu | Day at Leisure
activities: Welcome to Paro! Upon your arrival at Paro Airport, head to the immigration office for your travel permit. Then, get driven to your hotel in Thimphu. Check in & spend the day at leisure. You can explore Ludrong Memorial Garden, featuring 50 species of native Bhutanese plants & herbs. Experience Bhutanese culture at Simply Bhutan & witness live demonstrations of traditional crafts. You can also relax in Deer Park, modeled after India’s Deer Park. Later, return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Thimphu Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, you'll be driven to explore Thimphu. Visit the National Memorial Chorten & admire its religious paintings. Next, admire the 51.5-meter-tall Buddha Dordenma, housing the world’s largest Buddha statue. At Motithang Preserve, you might spot Bhutan's national animal. Then, explore Tashichho Dzong, a stunning fortress housing government offices, & Simtokha Dzong, the oldest dzong in Bhutan. Later, you can shop for souvenirs at the Handicrafts Emporium before getting driven to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Transfer to Paro | Paro Sightseeing Tour
activities: After checking out of your hotel, you'll be driven to Paro. Upon arrival, explore Drukgyel Dzong, which served as a stronghold against Tibetan invasions. Next, gaze at the majestic Mt. Jhomolhari, Bhutan’s second-highest peak at 7,314 meters, known for its stunning beauty and cultural significance. Visit Kyichu Lhakhang, one of Bhutan's oldest temples, dating back to the 7th century, believed to hold spiritual power. Afterward, check in at your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Hike to Tiger’s Nest Monastery
activities: Today, begin your journey at Ta Dzong, a watchtower that serves as a national museum.Next, visit Rinpung Dzong. Then, visit Tiger’s Nest parking lot, where your 7 km hike to the Taktsang Monastery. As you ascend through lush pine forests adorned with colorful prayer flags, take in the views of the Paro Valley. Upon arrival at the monastery, explore its prayer wheels, meditation caves, and intricate murals dedicated to Guru Rinpoche. Later, return to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Departure Day
activities: In the morning, get ready and check out of your hotel in Paro. Then, board your transfer and get driven to Paro Airport for your flight back home. This marks the end of your Bhutan Trip!

packages.title: Free Gangtey Gompa Monastery Excursion| Phuentsholing < Thimphu < Punakha < Paro ( 8 Days 7 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Destination Routes Coorg > Ooty > Kodaikanal > Bangalore

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Siliguri | Transfer to Phuntsholing | Day at Leisure
activities: Welcome to Siliguri! Upon arrival at the Bagdogra Airport/New Jalpaiguri Railway Station, board your transfer to the beautiful Phuntsholing Border Town. After checking in to your hotel, spend the rest of the day at leisure, where you can visit the Amo Chhu Crocodile Breeding Centre and witness the rare and endangered crocodiles up close. Also, you can stroll along the serene Torsa Riverside and soak-in its amazing atmosphere. Later, return to your hotel on your own for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Transfer to Thimphu | Day at Leisure
activities: After check-out, proceed to the immigration office & obtain your travel permit. Then, enjoy a scenic drive to Thimphu, & upon arrival, check in to your hotel and spend the rest of your day at leisure. You can visit Clock Tower Square and marvel at its intricate carvings with artistic designs. Also, you can explore Simply Bhutan and immerse yourself in Bhutan’s rich heritage through exhibits or visit the Royal Botanical Garden showcasing Bhutan’s diverse flora. Later, return to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Thimphu Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, explore Thimphu on a sightseeing tour. Start with a visit to the National Memorial Chorten & admire its intricate design stupa. Continue to the iconic Buddha Dordenma Statue, one of the world's largest Buddha statues, and witness Bhutan’s unique national animal, the Takin, at the Motithang Takin Preserve. Also, visit Tashichho Dzong before heading to Simtokha Dzong, the oldest dzong in Bhutan. Later, explore the Handicrafts Market for traditional souvenirs & get transferred to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Transfer to Punakha via Dochula Pass | Punakha Sightseeing Tour
activities: Post check out, board your transfer, & get driven to Punakha. En route, take a stop at the Dochula Pass and soak-in the stunning views of the Himalayan mountains. Once in Punakha, explore Punakha and visit Chimi Lhakhang, also called 'The Temple of Fertility.' Then, explore the Punakha Dzong, located between the Pho Chhu and Mo Chhu rivers. Also, admire its vibrant murals and intricate designs. Later, get transferred to your hotel for check-in and enjoy your comfortable overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Day Trip to Gangtey
activities: Today, enjoy a scenic drive to Gangtey, known for its natural beauty. Start with a visit to the Phobjikha Valley, a stunning glacial valley, home to the rare Tibetan black-necked cranes. Next, visit the iconic Gangtey Gompa Monastery and soak-in the views of the Phobjikha Valley. Continue to Wangdiphodrang Dzong, a fortress that stands at the confluence of the Mo Chhu and Tang Chhu rivers. Also, admire its stunning Bhutanese architecture before getting transferred to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 6 - Transfer to Paro | Paro Sightseeing Tour
activities: In the morning, check out and get transferred to Paro, passing through charming Bhutanese villages. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and later, enjoy a sightseeing tour. Start with a visit to the Drukgyel Dzong, an iconic fortress offering a glimpse into Bhutan's military past. Next, pay your respects at the Kyichu Lhakhang, one of Bhutan's oldest temples, dating back to the 7th century. After an amazing day, get transferred to your hotel for a comfortable overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 7 – Hike to Tiger’s Nest Monastery
activities: Today, visit Ta Dzong, a former watchtower now a National Museum showcasing Bhutan’s rich cultural heritage. Next, explore Rinpung Dzong, an iconic fortress with stunning Bhutanese architecture. Then, hike to the legendary Taktsang Monastery (Tiger’s Nest), perched on a cliffside. As you ascend through pine forests adorned with prayer flags, enjoy the breathtaking views. Upon reaching the temple, explore sacred meditation caves & murals. Afterwards, descend the trail & get driven to your hotel.

itinerary.day: DAY 8 - Departure Day
activities: After checking out of the hotel, you will be driven to the Bhutan Immigration Office. Complete your formalities and get transferred to Paro International Airport for your journey back home. This marks the end to your amazing Bhutan trip!

packages.title: FREE Dochu La Pass Excursion| Thimphu < Nubding < Punakha < Paro ( 7 Days 6 Nights )
packages.subTitle: Destination Routes Coorg > Ooty > Kodaikanal > Bangalore

itinerary.day: DAY 1 - Arrival in Paro | Transfer to Thimphu | Day at Leisure
activities: Welcome to Bhutan! Upon arrival at Paro Airport, head to the immigration office for your travel permit. Then, get driven to your hotel in Thimphu. Check in & spend the day at your leisure. You can visit places like the Royal Botanical Garden & the National Institute for Zorig Chusum, housing the Bhutanese arts & crafts. Also, visit Zilukha Anim Dratshang & learn about the nuns' lifestyles & experiences through interactive sessions. Later, return to the hotel on your own for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 2 - Thimphu Sightseeing Tour
activities: Today, get transferred to explore Thimphu. Visit the National Memorial Chorten, a stupa built in honour of Bhutan’s third king. Next, visit Tashichho Dzong, a fortress monastery that serves as Bhutan’s government’s seat. Continue to Simtokha Dzong & also witness the Buddha Dordenma statue. Head to the Motithang Takin Preserve to see Bhutan's national animal, the takin. Conclude your tour at the Handicrafts Market before getting driven to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 3 - Transfer to Nubding | Gangtey Sightseeing Tour
activities: After checking out of your hotel, you'll be driven to Nubding. En route stop at Dochula Pass & the historic Wangdue Phodrang Dzong, admired for its architecture. Upon arrival in Nubding, check in to your hotel and later embark on a sightseeing tour of Gangtey. Explore the peaceful Phobjikha Valley, famous for its beautiful landscapes and the winter home of the endangered blacknecked cranes. After visiting other such attractions, get transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 4 - Transfer to Punakha | Half-Day Punakha Sightseeing Tour
activities: After checking out of your hotel, you'll be transferred to Punakha. Upon arrival, check in and relax for a while. Later, get driven to explore Punakha. Start by visiting Punakha Dzong, a fortress located at the confluence of the Pho Chhu and Mo Chhu rivers, renowned for its architecture. Next, visit Chimi Lhakhang Temple, famously known as the Fertility Temple. Afterward, admire the serene beauty of the Mo Chhu River before getting driven to the hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 5 - Transfer to Paro | Paro Sightseeing Tour
activities: After checking out of your hotel, you'll be driven to Paro. Upon arrival, check in to your hotel and then embark on a sightseeing tour of Paro. Start with a visit to Kyichu Lhakhang, one of Bhutan's oldest and most sacred temples. Next, explore the ruins of Drukgyel Dzong, a historic fortress that offers views of the Paro Valley. Continue to the base of Mount Jhomolhari, Bhutan’s second-highest peak, revered as a sacred site. Later, get driven to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 6 - Hike To Tiger's Nest Monastery
activities: Today, you'll be driven to Ta Dzong, an ancient watchtower housing the National Museum of Bhutan. Next, explore the Rinpung Dzong, renowned for its impressive architecture. Afterward, proceed to Satsam Chencho Tshongkhang, the starting point for a scenic hike to the Taktsang Monastery, or Tiger’s Nest. Trek through lush pine forests, soaking in the surrounding views before reaching the monastery to explore the sacred site. Later, get transferred to your hotel for an overnight stay.

itinerary.day: DAY 7 – Departure Day
activities: Today, check out of the hotel and get transferred to the Paro International Airport to board your flight for the onward journey. This is where your trip comes to an end.
